name: The Ultimate High School Wrestling Quiz |   College Sports

questions.text: Who set the national record for wins in a career in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Roger Kish, MI.

	Roger Kish of Lapeer West, Michigan went 252-2 in a four year career. He won 4 state championships as well.

questions.text: Winning it's 30th state title in 2002, which school held the record for team state championships?
questions.explanation:
Perry, OK.

	Perry, OK had won 30 state titles since 1959.

questions.text: What was the record for consecutive team state titles, held by Coventry, RI?
questions.explanation:
17.

	Conventry, RI, won 17 in a row from 1982-98.

questions.text: What school held a record for most takedowns in a season, set in 1989?
questions.explanation:
St. Edwards, OH

	1,905 in one season by St. Edwards OH. Tops the record books by almost 400.

questions.text: Who set the record for most pins in a season in 1988?
questions.explanation:
Toby Heaton, MI.

	Toby Heaton, of Detroit Catholic Central, MI, pinned 53 opponents 1988. 8 of the top 10 people on this list are from Michigan.
